Whispers, secrets, and lies... #name# slept with the #occupation#.

Meanwhile on site: 
  #diganimals#  
    #archaeologists#
The #occupation# is drafting a report... ' #adj# #noun#: #adv# #verb# in archaeology '. It's not working.
#name# was working on the Harris Matrix. It may have released #deities#
#name# is doing some wet sieving, thinking 'Should've brought my wellies'.
'The archaeology of #noun#: the #adj# #noun# approach.' ...#name# scrunches up the paper, throws it away in disgust.
'The archaeology of #noun#: the #adj# #noun# approach.' ...'yeah, this works! yeah!' thinks #name# .
#deities# is devouring the soul of #name#.
#name# shouts 'the fleas! the fleas!'
The #occupation# is hiding the #noun# in the dirt, muttering, '#name# can go screw it'...
#name# grumbles darkly, sweeping up all the trash the g**d'd #occupation# left behind.
#name# stares blankly at the #matcul#, thinking, why do I do this?
#name# is leaving for home. The #occupation# is secretly heartbroken.
#name# the coroner is beginning to investigate the #occupation#. What happened to #name2#?
The #investigator# is asking questions about the #occupation#.
#name# is leaving for home. #name2# smiles grimly.
The #investigator# asks #name#, 'What happened on survey #4-9# days ago?'
The #investigator# asks #name#, 'Where were you at #1-12#:#1-3##4-9# #1-3# days ago? Was the #occupation# with you?
There is a book of #deities# on the #investigator#'s desk. #name# is worried.
The wind blows across the empty site,  while the team gathers in anxious conclave. 'Shit', thinks #name#.
matcul: altar echoing with the screams of the dead
activity: listening to #jam#, a most groovy tune indeed. But it's driving #name# insane.
going to wreak terrible revenge on the others.
blissfully unaware that anything could be wrong.
drawing another piece of damned brick.
loving every moment of the experience.
staring in mute horror at the gash in their hand from the trowel.

whatanswer: See, in years to come, #name2# will feel nothing but regret.
whoanswer: That's a good question. The #occupation# knows something...
The #investigator# is on it. Our lawyers advise us to say nothing.
whenanswer: #name#'s report will come out  in an Elsevier journal someday.
whyanswer: #name# raises an eyebrow and stares at you.
#deities# scour your soul and grind your ashes into the spoil heap.
anyotherquestion: The answer is buried in Open Context
We publish in an obscure journal
The #investigator#'s final report is pending, so we can't answer that
The #occupation# won't let us answer until #name#'s report is out.
Sometimes, there is no good response.
Hodder. Hodder is always the answer. Unless it's Hodor.
It's an archaeology of #noun#, and #name# approves.
The #occupation#'s final report covers all that.
That perspective wouldn't last long on site - the #occupation# or perhaps #deities# would see to it...
Multivocality always gets you in the end. Or #deities#. Could go either way.
Why don't you come on survey with us... #preface##defs##mountains##ending#
This is a slow archaeology. We never seem to get anything done.
We've had some ... openings... on our team. Apply now!
Pay $#1-3#k, and you can dig here too with #name#.
howanswer: #deities# is released by the interdimensionality caused by #name#'s work on the Harris matrix
We said that #name# shouldn't have opened the temple doors, but oh no...
shouldanswer: We asked #name#, who wrote 'An Archaeology of #verb.capitalize#'. The answer is #yesno#.
This isn't magic 8 ball, you know.
This is all very meta, isn't it.
abstruseanswer: Look, the #occupation# won't let us answer until #name#'s report is out.
How did you know about that?
